Surge in COVID: 19 cases worldwide: The expert mentions that communities around the world are experiencing a surge in COVID-19 cases, with Europe facing a second wave and hospitals being overwhelmed. This aspect verifies the claim's inaccuracy by providing evidence of the ongoing pandemic.
Record: breaking new cases in the United States: The expert highlights that nearly two dozen states in the United States are reporting their worst weeks ever for new COVID-19 cases. This fact further supports the claim's inauthenticity, as it contradicts the notion of the pandemic ending soon.
Flagged by Facebook for false news: The claim was flagged by Facebook as part of their efforts to combat false news and misinformation. This aspect adds credibility to the expert's verdict and indicates that the claim lacks authenticity.
High global death toll and infections: The expert mentions that globally, more than 1 million people have died due to COVID-19, with over 230,000 deaths in the United States alone. This information reinforces the severity of the pandemic and refutes the claim's assertion of COVID-19 ending soon.
